formalpara.title: Figure 6. Asymmetric localization of components of the Wnt/β-catenin asymmetry pathway in seam cells.
formalpara.para: (a), (h) Schematic summaries of the localization patterns of components of the Wnt/β-catenin asymmetry pathway prior to (a) or after (h) seam-cell division. (b-g) and (i-l) are confocal images of their localizations. In seam cells, LIN-17 (Fz) (b) and DSH-2 (Dsh) (c) localize to the posterior cortex, and APR-1 (APC) (d), PRY-1 (Axin) (e), WRM-1 (β-catenin) (f), and LIT-1 (NLK) (g) are in the anterior cortex. After the asymmetric cell divisions, WRM-1 (i), LIT-1 (j), and SYS-1 (β-catenin) (k) localize to the nucleus of the posterior daughter, whereas POP-1 (l) is more concentrated in the nucleus of the anterior daughter. (b-c) and (i-l) are the T cell, and (d-g) are the V5.p cell. The shapes of the nuclei are indicated by dotted lines in (i-l). Anterior is toward the left, and ventral is toward the bottom.
